intro: Croton loukandensis, commonly known as the Loukanda croton, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often brightly colored and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
